<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5d72ce69c8783fd8f1a0355c00806c5084010eec|patch 8.2.1500: Vim9: error when using address without a command>
patch 8.2.1500: Vim9: error when using address without a command

Problem:    Vim9: error when using address without a command.
Solution:   Execute the range itself. (closes #6747)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1500: Vim9: error when using address without a command · vim/vim@5d72ce6
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1500: Vim9: error when using address without a command · vim/vim@5d72ce6
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: error when using address without a command. Solution: Execute the range itself. (closes #6747)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ec65d77fa26cc87f7ce54a5a941a799e3a667c50|patch 8.2.1499: Vim9: error when using "$" with col()>
patch 8.2.1499: Vim9: error when using "$" with col()

Problem:    Vim9: error when using "$" with col().
Solution:   Reorder getting the column value. (closes #6744)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1499: Vim9: error when using "$" with col() · vim/vim@ec65d77
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1499: Vim9: error when using "$" with col() · vim/vim@ec65d77
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: error when using "$" with col(). Solution: Reorder getting the column value. (closes #6744)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/733d259a83bfdd3e1670cc1665e1bd56501799df|patch 8.2.1498: on slow systems tests can be flaky>
patch 8.2.1498: on slow systems tests can be flaky

Problem:    On slow systems tests can be flaky.
Solution:   Use TermWait() instead of term-wait(). (Yegappan Lakshmanan,
            closes #6756)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1498: on slow systems tests can be flaky · vim/vim@733d259
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1498: on slow systems tests can be flaky · vim/vim@733d259
attachments.text: Problem: On slow systems tests can be flaky. Solution: Use TermWait() instead of term-wait(). (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #6756)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/17f67547f36a06220ea4667aaee7bb130108f568|patch 8.2.1497: CursorHold test is flaky>
patch 8.2.1497: CursorHold test is flaky

Problem:    CursorHold test is flaky. (Jakub Kądziołka)
Solution:   Use WaitForAssert() (closes #6754)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1497: CursorHold test is flaky · vim/vim@17f6754
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1497: CursorHold test is flaky · vim/vim@17f6754
attachments.text: Problem: CursorHold test is flaky. (Jakub Kądziołka) Solution: Use WaitForAssert() (closes #6754)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/b8a9296cedb9fae35572041ef5cfa894f3ad9fbb|patch 8.2.1496: Vim9: cannot use " #" in a mapping>
patch 8.2.1496: Vim9: cannot use " #" in a mapping

Problem:    Vim9: cannot use " #" in a mapping.
Solution:   Do not remove a comment with the EX_NOTRLCOM flag. (closes #6746)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1496: Vim9: cannot use " #" in a mapping · vim/vim@b8a9296
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1496: Vim9: cannot use " #" in a mapping · vim/vim@b8a9296
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot use " #" in a mapping. Solution: Do not remove a comment with the EX_NOTRLCOM flag. (closes #6746)
